bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Church Extension Board of the Presbytery of Brooklyn-Nassau, Inc. was an agency created in 1914 to house the Presbytery's records, to aid in the establishment of new churches, and to give assistance to existing churches. The agency was located on Clinton Street in Brooklyn Heights.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: R.H. Woodman (1841-1943), born in Brooklyn, was organist and choirmaster at First Presbyterian Church in Brooklyn Heights from 1880 to 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Church Extension Board of the Presbytery of Brooklyn-Nassau records span the period 1889 to 1962 and measure 0.25 linear feet. The records include financial documents and minutes of the Church Extension Board, a choir roll book, and letters written by R. H. Woodman.
